thread.title: David Haye's career in serious doubt after boxer is taken to London hospital following Achilles injury
thread.title_full: David Haye's career in serious doubt after boxer is taken to London hospital following Achilles injury

author: Joe Mewis
title: David Haye's career in serious doubt after boxer is taken to London hospital following Achilles injury
text:
Sport David Haye's career in serious doubt after boxer is taken to London hospital following Achilles injury The Haymaker went down in the sixth round after rolling his ankle but battled on until being stopped in the 11th Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Mirror boxing correspondent David Anderson give his ringside verdict on Haye vs Bellew Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
David Haye 's boxing career is in serious doubt following his 11th round stoppage against Tony Bellew. 
The London fighter appeared to injure his right Achilles in the sixth round but refused to throw in the towel, bravely continuing on one leg until the penultimate round when the bout was stopped. 
Haye went into the fight as the heavy favourite to defeat Bellew but quickly struggled to land his power punches against the conservative Bellew. 
And once Haye twisted his ankle awkwardly in the sixth round, the former World heavyweight champion faced a mountain to climb despite being up on the cards. Haye struggles to his feet after being knocked down (Photo: REUTERS) Haye is batted through the ropes (Photo: REUTERS) Haye's ankle twists in the sixth round (Photo: REUTERS) Haye has severe taping on his right leg (Photo: REUTERS) Haye and Bellew embrace after the fight (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Twitter reacts to Tony Bellew's shock win over David Haye: 'Bomber couldn't knock him out on one leg!' 
Haye bravely battled on, throwing hopeful hooks - some of which caught the Bomber, who seemed to gas in the second half of the fight. 
He was then battered through the ropes in the 11th round and despite rising to his feet, trainer Shane McGuigan chucked the towel into the ring with the referee waving the contest off. Read More
